sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action creates an invite for the candidate to fill out the application.

Inputs:

  • Candidate ID - ID of the candidate for whom the invite is to be created.
  • Package - Package to be requested in the order, once the candidate submits the application.
  • Position Applied For - Name of the position to apply.
  • Position Locations - Location details of the position to apply.
    • City - Position in the city.
    • State - Position in the state.
    • Country - Position in the country.
  • Notification URL - A ServiceNow callback URL for First Advantage status notifications.
  • Client References - A ServiceNow case or request ID.
  • User Defined Fields - Custom fields.
  • Quotebacks - Quoteback reference for clients.
    • Name - Quoteback name.
    • Value - Quoteback value.
  • Order As - Order on behalf of a user with following details:
    • Account ID - Requested account ID.
    • User ID - Requested user ID.
    • Email - Requested email ID.
  • Candidate Type - Type of the candidate. Default value is "PROFILE".

Outputs:

  • Applicant ID - ID of the invite created for the candidate.
  • Status - Will be set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • Provided Candidate ID is invalid or not found.
  • Provided value for Package input is invalid.
  • Provided value for Position Applied For input is invalid.
  • Provided value for Quote Backs input is invalid.
  • Provided value for Notification URL is invalid.
  • Either Account ID, User ID or Email under Order As is not provided.
  • Provided value for Account ID or User ID in Order As input is invalid/incorrect.
  • Provided value for Candidate Type is incorrect/invalid.
  • Provided value for one or more inputs is invalid.
  • Invalid username or password/token or the token has expired.
  • The user does not have sufficient permission to perform this action.

To use this action, the corresponding First Advantage connection and credential must be created and associated with the First Advantage Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
sys_hub_action_type_definition.name: Create Invite

  • Order As - Order on behalf of a user with following details:
